results.title: Program 2 [DVD]
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Treasures from the American Film Archives: 50 preserved films (DVD)”.
For decades archives have worked behind the scenes to save America’s film heritage. Now for the first time, eighteen of the nation’s premier archives join forces to showcase the range of films that survive today thanks to their efforts. Essays about the archives narrated by Laurence Fishburne. Newly recorded musical scores by Martin Marks. This disk contains the following titles: Paper print copyright deposits 7 min: ‘Star Theatre’ (1901), ‘Move On’ (1903), ‘Dog Factory’ (1904)—’The Lonedale Operator’ (1911), 17 mins—’Her Crowning Glory’ (1911), 14 mins—’The Toll of the Sea’ (1922) 54 mins—From ‘Accuracy First’ (ca. 1928), 5 mins—From West Virginia Documentaries 9 mins: ‘West Virginia, the State Beautiful’ (1929), ‘One-Room Schoolhouses’ (ca. 1935)—From ‘Early Amateur Sound Film’ (1936-37), 4 mins—’Composition 1’ (Themis) (1940), 4 mins—’The Battle of San Pietro’ (1945) 33 mins—’Negro Leagues Baseball’ (1946) 8 mins—’Battery Film’ (1985), 9 mins. Further Information: http://www.filmpreservation.org/

results.title: Program 1 [DVD]
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Treasures from the American Film Archives: 50 preserved films (DVD)”.
For decades archives have worked behind the scenes to save America’s film heritage. Now for the first time, eighteen of the nation’s premier archives join forces to showcase the range of films that survive today thanks to their efforts. This disk contains the following titles: “The Original movie” (1922), 8 mins; early films from the Edison Company 3 mins - “Blacksmithing scene” (1893), “The Gay shoe clerk” (1903), “Three American beauties” (1906); “Princess Nicotine or, The Smoke fairy” (1909), 5 mins; “The Confederate ironclad” (1912), 16 mins; “Hells hinges” (1916), 64 mins; “The Fall of the house of Usher” (1928), 13 mins; “From Groucho Marx’s home movies” (ca. 1933), 2 mins; From “Tevye” (1939), 17 mins; “Cologne: from the diary of Ray and Esther” (1939), 14 mins; Private Snafu: “Spies” (1943), 4 mins; “OffOn” (1968), 9 mins. Essays about the archives narrated by Laurence Fishburne. Newly recorded musical scores by Martin Marks. Further Information: http://www.filmpreservation.org/

results.title: Profit, you gotta be out of your cotton pickin' mind
results.creator_credit: Nick Bosustow, Stephen Bosustow Productions and Sam Weiss
results.brief_description: Making a profit, the essence of business survival, is humorously traced in retelling the story of Eli Whitney and his cotton gin. This animated story illustrates a simple explanation of the need for profit in business.

results.creator_credit: Humphrey Swingler, British Productivity Council and John Ingram

results.title: Profiles of elementary physical education
results.brief_description: Methods in teaching physical education and guiding class activities for kindergarten through elementary grades. Starting with kindergarten and carrying through the elementary grades this film stresses the successful methods used in the teaching of physical education. It urges careful organisation and presents many ideas for the guidance of class activities. Based on the physical education program of Cleveland schools, this film is invaluable to the beginning as well as to the experienced teacher of physical education in any elementary school system.

results.title: Profile: Canada
results.creator_credit: Jim Turpie, ONF | NFB and Crawley Films
results.brief_description: This film offers a magnificent panorama of Canada from coast to coast. The land, the people, the industries, the pleasures - in fact the entire life of the nation is beautifully filmed in this colorful composite survey.

results.title: Profile of a quartet
results.creator_credit: Peter Newington, BBC-TV and Humphrey Burton
results.brief_description: A glimpse of the work which goes into a production of good chamber music. Introduces the members of the Quartet both at home with their families and at rehearsal together where much discussion takes place and several pieces of chamber music are played. Illustrates the focussing of the four men’s lives to produce this close teamwork.

results.title: Profile of a problem drinker
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB and Stanley Jackson
results.brief_description: The causes of drinking and the effects of liquor on the life of a young architect, analysing some of the reasons which may lead to a person to problem drinking. Shows the importance of recognising the early symptoms of alcoholism and dramatises the remedial action necessary for effective cure..
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB and Stanley Jackson

results.title: Professor Hoffnug's Yaya's memoirs
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Hoffnung”.
On his birthday Professor Ya Ya amusingly recalss come musical performances by members of his family including Uncle Alfredo in Naples, Cousin Augustra in Madrid, Uncle Giovan at La Scala, and finally Ya YA Junior , a opo singer on television. One of a series based on Gerard Hoffnung’s cartoon drawings.

results.title: Professor Finger builds a bridge
results.creator_credit: Robert Maxwell, Joseph E. Levine, Anroste Films and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “DoDo: the kid from outer space”.
Dodo and the bird come to the rescue of the Professor when his new inventions of a plastic bridge over a ravine cannot take the stress. The remains of the bridge become a ferry instead.
